Hunger is a political condition. We have the food. We have the resources. But we lack the political will.   I'm hopeful that with @JoeBiden & @KamalaHarris we will take bold action to #endhungernow. https://t.co/mPc95GM0OS

Although #MontesMarch is over - you can still contribute. Over the last two days we heard from food pantry after food pantry about the increased demand they are seeing as a result of the pandemic.   Your donation will going a long way to #endhungernow: https://t.co/P9BX0bV0qD
To the sponsors marchers (in person & virtual) and donors - this truly historic #MontesMarch would not be possible without your support: THANK YOU - THANK YOU - THANK YOU!
To our leaders & organizers who pull #MontesMarch together every year: THANK YOU!   The one & only @MonteBelmonte & his team at @River939 & Andrew Morehouse & his team at the @FoodBankWMA.

To my friends in the local & state gov who marched with us: THANK YOU!   @Jo_Comerford @EricLesser @SenJohnVelis @Vote4gonzalez @AaronMVega @SabadosaMA @rep_carey @BlaisForMA @MindyForMA @RepPaulMark @MayorLachapelle DA David Sullivan

Every year I'm a little sore the day after #MontesMarch - but every year I'm inspired by our community & the commitment we show to one another.   2020 has been difficult for many but thank you to all who made the last few days a huge success!   https://t.co/oCllCTUk9K

One of the things I missed on this year’s #MontesMarch is seeing all the school children cheering us on along the way.   I’m glad - and inspired - that so many still found a way to ‘march’ along with us this year.  Thank you Colrain Central School first graders - you rock! https://t.co/MVhvXfSmmr

In order for anything to change we need to build a grassroots movement to elect candidates who commit to overturning Citizens United as a top priority.   I'm proud to partner with organizations like @StopBigMoney and @usapromise that work every day to make this change possible.
That is why I have consistently offered two constitutional amendments that 1. limits the amount of $$ in our political system and 2. declares that corporations are NOT people.

I could go on & on about the corrupting influence of big money in our politics.   All I know is that we must end it once for all.   I believe that the power should lie in the hands of the American people not in the boardrooms on Wall Street.

4. It's allowed industries like the gun lobby to spend an absurd amount of $$ to influence lawmakers on policy decisions.   For example the NRA spent $35 million of dark money in 2016 alone at a time when large majorities of Americans favor stricter gun control measures.

3. 86% of all outside spending in federal elections over the last 30 years has occurred in the last 10 alone. (Center for Responsive Politics)  Let me repeat: 86% of ALL outside spending in federal elections over the last THIRTY years has come in the last TEN years alone.

2. Since 2010 over $4.4 billion dollars was spent by outside groups according to the Center for Responsive Politics.   Nearly $1 billion of that was spent by unaccountable "dark money" groups - that's a billion with a B.

What does this all mean?   1. The Citizens United decision helped to create what is called "dark money" groups which allows for any special interest to spend unlimited $$ in support of or against a candidate without disclosing their donors.

10 years ago the Supreme Court opened the flood gates to unlimited & unaccountable money in our elections through the disastrous Citizens United decision.   It's given undue influence to wealthy donors & big money special interests & bolstered corporate personhood.
